programme.desc: Leo discovers that a satin bowerbird has been stealing blue objects from him and his family. Realising that the satin bowerbird might be lost, the Junior Rangers set out to bring the satin bowerbird back to its bower.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Today’s mission: return a white-bellied woodpecker to its rightful place in the rainforest! The Junior Rangers try to do just that, but come under attack by a swarm of wasps. Will the Junior Rangers succeed in their mission, or face the sting of defeat?

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Gaspard are super impatient to go pick up the newspaper in the village with Grandpa. That’s because they are going to be able to sit in the motorcycle side-car. Awwwwesome! And especially because they are also going to be able to buy candy. What could be cooler?! Unfortunately, the side-car stalls on their way into town. What are they going to do? Well, to begin with, they are going to call the mechanic. No, but what are they going to do about the candy??!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On Reggie Squirrel’s seventh birthday, he couldnt find his friends at home. He runs into Harry Hedgehog, who offers to take him for a ride in a carriage. When they return, the forest inhabitants celebrate Reggie Squirrel together, giving him seven candles as a gift. They then fly in a hot air balloon, marveling at the night sky. Finally, Reggie Squirrel happily returns home and wishes his friends a good night.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble and Stanley gather chestnuts, and then they create marvelous figures out of them at the house of the stag beetle. Bubble takes the figures home, but upon seeing the mess, Stanley offers his help. In the process, they get caught up in a series of accidents, resulting in the gingerbread house breaking. Bubble receives a new gingerbread house from Rosita the rose beetle and happily tidies up his room.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The green Grub wants to stay with Dolly for the winter, but always finds her at the wrong time with the request. The Wind accidentally blows the The Green Grub to the seaside, then brings it back to Dolly. Finally, Dolly happily welcomes the Green Grub for the winter and prepares a comfortable bed for him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 05 Mepe
programme.desc: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They have many adventures, while they make new friends and get knowledge about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest hold a baking contest to celebrate the arrival of summer, but Dr Owl goes overboard with tasting. With the help of Beetle Bodobács, they manage to save the evening with chimney cakes and dancing. The next day, Dr Owl apologizes and improves his mood with a group workout.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a rainy day, Dollys house gets flooded. When the rain stops, Stanley, the stag beetle, repairs the roof. Berry also helps Dolly, who is upset about her soaked drawings. Berry visits Raymond, the copper beetle, who has plenty of bells. He asks for two special bells to cheer Dolly up. At home, he makes coconut balls and later delivers them to Dolly along with the bells, which make her very happy. Later, Berry paints over the stain caused by the rain, and Dolly repaints the pictures with the help of Flutter and Leapy. The bells bring joy to the house.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, catches a cold on a gloomy, rainy day. Doctor Owl examines her and advises her to rest a lot in bed. Her friends visit often to take care of her, and Flutter always asks them to read from her new book. Soon, everyone knows the story, which tells of a ball held in a splendid castle. One day, Balthazar makes Flutter sad by saying that the princess story is just a fairy tale. Flutter turns away, disappointed, and falls asleep. Balthazar meets Doctor Owl, who notices that something is bothering him.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: During Bing’s bedtime routine he inadvertently pees on his blankie and it’s too wet to wash and dry before bed. Fortunately his Hoppity Voosh toy has a cape just as soft and huggy as blankie and it even smells just right too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco shows Bing how to do really good Big Boos and together they make Flop jump. When Bing tries out his new tricks on Charlie he finds out the power of Boo has to be scaled down for babies.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula discover a new toy at Amma’s crèche, a talking ride on car. It seems like fun until Talkie Taxi keeps saying the same thing over and over again. When the taxi crashes and is finally silenced Bing and Sula use their imagination to play a game they really want to play without being dictated to by the noisy taxi.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its a windy day, and Bing wants to fly his Hoppity Voosh kite with Flop.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: When Tilda breaks a teacup right after getting up, for Molly theres only one explanation: its Friday the 13th. At first, Tilda dismisses this as pure superstition. After several further mishaps, however, she begins to worry that maybe there is something to it. Her friends are absolutely convinced.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda dreams of learning to fly. Excited by Robin Robins statement that anyone with wings can fly, Tilda makes herself some from lettuce leaves. Robin is supposed to give her flying instruction, but she gets bored with all the tedious theory. Molly gets Rupert to help persuade Tilda flying is a bad idea.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: One day, Tilda opens her front door and cant believe her eyes: theres an egg in her front garden. While Tilda asks Robin Robin for tips on egg care, Molly distributes flyers in Wild Rose Lane to find the owner. After a while, the egg cracks open and a chick hatches. As at that moment Tilda is not at home, the chick thinks Molly is its mother.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse pick lots of delicious strawberries. Little Nutbrown Hare eats all his and runs out so Little Field Mouse shares hers with him. When he goes to collect some more for his friend he eats them all too. Little Field Mouse shows him how to eat them really slowly to make them last longer.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare makes a slippery slide from a pile of snow and has so much fun he decides to keep it a secret and play with it all by himself. But he soon gets bored playing by himself, and invites his friends to play. They build bigger and curvier slides together and slide faster and faster. Little Nutbrown Hare learns it’s lots more fun to shares the joy with his friends.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: After Big Nutbrown Hare shows Little Nutbrown Hare a special place where his voice echoes, he and Little Field Mouse play a game of Try to find me with Little Redwood Fox and Little Grey Squirrel. They hide in the ravine and as their voices bounce off the rocky walls, their friends have a very tricky time trying to find them.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: When Simon and Ferdinand see Mommy and Daddy playing badminton, they want to try too: playing with rackets looks like a cinch! Except that no, it’s super hard to hit the birdie with these big rackets. They aren’t able to have one single volley. Simon is determined though, yes, they are going to do it! But it will have to wait until after lunch because Daddy has just called them to table. During the meal, Gaspard, but not on purpose, pops off the top of his apple sauce and Simon’s immediate reflex is to hit it in mid-air with his big spoon. Yes, he did it!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: After an Asian palm civet steals Hero’s food, the Junior Rangers set off to bring the civet back to where it belongs. The trip takes them to the rainforest, a durian plantation and a run-in with a wild boar!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Hoot and Toot must decide the best order in which to do three jobs: pick up the Mayor, clean the tunnel with the scrub-a-chug and have a chugwash. Deciding they should look their best for the Mayor, they have a chugwash first. Then they clean the tunnels – which gets them filthy again! They’re afraid they won’t earn their badges – until they use the scrub-a-chug to clean themselves. Now sparkling, they pick up the Mayor and Vee awards them their badges!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Hoot and Toot must make deliveries through the night, finishing before sunrise. Away from Chuggington, when Hoot’s light fails, he screeches to a halt and is too scared to move! But with some gentle encouragement and clever shadow play from Toot, Hoot realises how much fun the night time can be. All their jobs get done before sunrise, and the twins win their badges

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is feeling a bit grumpy. He’s even refusing to play with Nina: our little hero is missing his grandparents and friends back home. But Mom reassures him: it’s normal to sometimes feel a little down when you’re away your loved - ones. To cheer him up, Dad suggests they make changes to the cottage, to remind him of his house back home, and his family! Tchoupi suddenly switches from feeling sad to feeling ecstatic! He’s eager to invite Nina to celebrate this happy day with him… but can’t find her anywhere! This gets him worrying: what if his friend took off because of how unkind he was to her this morning?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and his family arrive at the hamlet for their first day of vacation. Having been told by his parents that their stay will be packed with surprises, T’choupi has high expectations! But disappointment sets in fast: not only does he find the dog daunting, he also notices there’s no slide, or TV, or pool! This place is going to be sooo boring!!... Until he finds out there’s a girl his age living there. Huh, where?! T’choupi can’t wait to meet this mysterious potential playmate!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Dad sends Tchoupi and Nina out on a mission: to go to the vegetable garden and find the veggies he needs to make a nice mixed salad! The kids are delighted… until they discover that the tomatoes - the main ingredient for Dad’s salad - are green instead of red! Nina comes up with a solution she heard about from her mom: music!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Charley just doesnt get it: everyone accuses him of things hes never done! Until he discovers a little boy on the sports course who looks a lot like him and is a real scoundrel. So hes the one doing the mischief, not Charley! But how do you tell the little rascal to behave?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam got a wrong idea about what Julias life was like when she lived on her island. Julia try to show Sam by immersing him in a tropical atmosphere, reconstituted at the Mouse Mansion.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: To participate at the annual cheese hunt with the other children of the residence, Julia faces a problem : she has a cold and cant sniff anything. Sam is going to help her to play with them anyway!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When the Rickety Old Bridge collapses, trapping Toby and Henrietta on the other side of the ravine, Inventor Ruth is asked to build a new one.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Yong Bao tells Thomas the story of how he came to have a magnificent tiger emblem on his tender

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou goes to the water park and faces pirates, races down lazy river, and rides a big slide!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou gets stung by a bee, but learns that bees are special creatures that dont want to hurt people!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: It seems some sort of monster is causing havoc in Busytown Lake. The kids catch glimpses of it and find numerous finny footprints by the shoreline. However closer investigation reveals it to be Mr Fix-It’s latest invention – a swim fin-wheeled amphibious submarine car!/Huckle and his pals try to track down a bad driver.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey is expecting a visit from his friend Frog; in the meantime he practices his leapfrog abilities. When Frog finally arrives Monkey has an even better idea, that they play his favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey thinks he’s got a scary roar although the fly that’s bothering him doesn’t seem to think so. Hearing his friend Lion, Monkey realizes that he needs to learn how to roar properly. With the ‘King of the jungle’s’ help Monkey plays his favorite game… Monkey see Monkey do!!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: With the cadets stoked to take a helicopter ride on Wallaby 2, Sam and Elvis must pull a high-flying rescue when a scary incident occurs.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: It’s fright night for Norman after he watches a scary movie, but his panic leaves him thinking everyone is turning into Pontypandy Zombies… Pondies. He tries to signal for help but ends up trapped in a burning building. The Fire Team are called to the rescue.

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: Franklin is nervous about finding his own special beat to play at Aunt T’s Drum Circle. Only when he stops and listens does he find a beat unique to himself – his heartbeat. /Franklin enlists the help of all his friends to make a cardboard play plane but then alienates them all when he won’t let anyone else be pilot. Only after he’s left to play on his own does he finally realize that the plane should really belong to all of them -- and it’s much more fun to share!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: After spending the day with Rosie, Basil walks his daughter back to the burrow, but she feels that the time has flown by too fast. Trying to spend just a little more time with her dad, she invites Basil in to say hello to the rest of the family. As he has neverbeen inside the burrow, Basil hesitates… Edmund confirms Rosies invitation: Basil is very welcome inside the burrow! ToRosie and the little badgers’ great delight, Basil accepts to come in for a moment.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: It’s so hot! cries Sketcky! What is better than a Riddleboo to know how to get refreshed?

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky is thrilled to have plenty of treats for the upcoming Halloween and hopes to have more than the year before. But how to do it? Doodleboo has an idea: he knows what makes it possible to collect even more candy on Halloween!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky wonders about the island in the distance. He would like to see it more closely, but how? Fortunately, Doodleboo has the solution.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave go in search of Littlest Bunny’s missing cuddly carrot toy. They search all the places that Little Bunny has played that day, one by one, without success. It’s only when they have learned to look carefully and check big open spaces thoroughly, by walking slowly in lines from one side to the other, that they find it. They also find Penny Hen’s lost scarf, Herman the Hermit Crab’s beach bucket and Cindy Squirrel’s missing nuts!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave have fun at the Animal Day Parade. They decorate their Rollypod trailers, transforming them into colourful floats and give some of their animal friends a lift to the parade. The parade queen is chosen and everyone ready, until Sneezy Sheep’s giant parade balloon floats away! Hatty saves the day and proudly leads them all in the parade.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends go on a hunt for treasure in the meadow and collect all kinds of unique gems like flowers, feathers, apples and egg-shells. But there’s a hole in Little Nutbrown Hare’s leaf-bag and he loses the precious collection along the way. Luckily, Big Nutbrown Hare is not far behind to collect the lost treasure as well as follow its trail to find his son.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse innocently pick lots of Spring flowers from a field and deliver bunches to their friends. When they realise that they are being followed everywhere by a cloud of yellow butterflies, they realise that the butterflies need the flowers, to feed from their nectar. How will they lead the little butterflies to more flowers and sweet nectar?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One clear Spring night, Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse settle in to enjoy Little White Owl’s story of adventure and treasures. Inspired by her tale, the two set out to try and touch the most special treasure of all – a shiny star. They climb higher and higher but the beautiful stars seem just out of reach. Will they find a way to get their wish?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has a brand new Hoppity Voosh lunch box, and Pando has the exact same one – match! At first it’s fun to match, but that changes when Bing and Pando mix their lunchboxes up and end up with the wrong lunch.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco is staying at Bings house for her first sleepover but things dont go so well when they find out their different bedtime routines.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula have a penny each for the Surprise Machine in Padget’s shop. Sula gets the silver rhino she wanted so Bing is convinced he will get the toy he wants too. When the Surprise Machine delivers his capsule Bing is upset to discover the alien he has set his heart on is not inside.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to get dizzy on the roundybout so Pando pushes him. Its not long before Bing realises that some dizzy is fun but too much dizzy is not fun at all.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing builds a house out of sofa cushions and Coco decides its perfect for a game of Big Bad Wolf. Bing enjoys being wolfie until hes not allowed into the house he built.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The Ant Queen has just recovered from a long sickness, so the ants decide to build her a giant Ferris Wheel on top of the hill. The work isnt going as fast as theyve planned, so the forest friends decide to help them. The work still goes slowly, so they sadly give up, but then the night stars arrive to help the group, and the Ferris Wheel is finally complete.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The three bark beetles cant decide what costume to wear to the spring carnival party. So they ask the help of Leapy. Since she also still hasnt gotten a costume yet, they come up with the idea to dress as the four seasons. Leapy becomes Spring, and the three bark beetles become Summer, Fall and Winter. The four seasonelves go on to win the costume contest at the party.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In January, Eddy the Potato beetle and his friends visit Stanley, who presents his new toy cars. Eddy would like to try out the silver truck but accidentally breaks it. The next day, Eddy confesses his mistake and compensates Stanley with a golden-colored vehicle, while Patrik, the handyman beetle, repairs the wheel.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In February, the little friends gather for a carnival party and agree that there wont be a costume competition. Instead, the girls dress up as vegetables, while the boys dress up as fruits. However, Katie, the yellow ladybird and Snail Sam are not aware of this arrangement. So when they burst into Vendes house where the ball is taking place, everyone teams up to creatively transform their costumes. The friends enjoy the celebration, which is made complete by a large basket of colorful carnival donuts. On their way home, they admire the first snowdrops.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids try to find the owner of a camera using the photos for clues. All the pictures are sporting events, so they eventually find out the camera belongs to the sports reporter for the Busytown Bugle./ A list Sally made mysteriously disappears right off the page.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey wants to dress up as something special no one has ever seen before... Mole then appears and tells them about how birds of paradise are known as being unique. When they arrive at the forest, they meet Bird of paradise. They learn about finding their unique look and grove, and Monkey invites Bird of paradise to play Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: At the garage, Joe, Hannah, and James try to point a giant laser beam at the moon to measure how far away it is. Norman worries they’ll lead Moon Men down to Pontypandy, putting everyone in danger… but it’s his panic that ends up causing a fire!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy wants to be the fastest delivery person ever! Her dad upgrades her scooter, and she speeds through her deliveries… until she hits a bump, loses her brakes, and needs to be rescued before she gets to the cliffs!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate wonders what’s wrong with her birdhouse— the birds aren’t visiting it. In Mimiloo, Kate, Mim-Mim and their friends offer to babysit a shape-changing baby squoosh so its mama squoosh can focus on building a nest. But getting the squoosh to nap and eat is harder than it sounds!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate’s sad because her snowman is melting! In Mimiloo, it’s a sweltering hot day so Kate, Mim-Mim and their friends head to the Winter Waterfalls to cool down—only to find that all the ice is melting! To re-freeze the waterfalls, Kate will have to find Chilly, the snowman who keeps the Winter Waterfalls cold, snowy and frozen.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi is pretending to Nina that he’s able to read… but loses track of the story he’s trying to tell. An idea suddenly springs to mind: why doesn’t he just make up the rest of the story, in real life?!... The only thing they need to make it complete is a little chick to play the hero of their adventure. But when catching it turns out to be a lot more difficult than they’d bargained for, they realize they may just be living the true adventure, in real time…!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Inspired by Nina’s drawing of a rainbow, Tchoupi lists out all the colors within it. When he gets it wrong, Nina suggests they turn it into a game and look for the various hues in Nature. Loving the idea, Mom suggests they go find the colors on the flowers and vegetables in the hamlet. Nina and Tchoupi come back in next to no time, mission accomplished! Recognizing their talent, Dad ups the stakes, setting them the challenge of spotting the rainbow colors… among the animals! Mmm, easier said than done…

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia have adopted a pumpkin theyve nicknamed Leo. But Sams dad is planning to make with it a delicious soup for the whole building. The two friends try anything they can to save him.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Which child will get the big spoon for the annual fondue held in memory of the very first residents of th Mouse Mansion. Sam and Julia are in competition, will their friendship hold up?

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: The big neighbourhood race is coming up, and Snaily, who came in last place last year, dreams of winning this time. He discovers his talent on Billys skateboard, but the rules stand in his way.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Mom is having a dinner party at home tonight and she is running all over the place to finish cleaning the house in time. When she goes out to do a round-trip to the bakery, the Triplets decide to give her a hand. But nothing goes as planned: the vacuum cleaner brakes, the couch is stained and the corridor is full of soap. Be careful Mom, the floor is very very slippery!

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: An animal and pets magazine is organizing a wonderful contest to win a subscription: you have to send them a picture of your dog and relate its achievements. The Triplets decide to photograph Toto but cannot seem to find what he can do. Would he have what it takes to assist firemen? Policemen? Or detectives? Oh no! Just thinking about it makes Toto tremble with fear. The Triplets must think fast, there are only a few hours left to participate. But suddenly it hits them: of course, Toto is a hug specialist!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Woodsy wants to decorate his room with a huge branch that he found lying in the river and which he believes to be very beautiful. But his room is also Scoutbadger’s room and the latter doesnt agree at all. Scoutbadger thinks that this piece of wood isnt pretty at all. Quite the opposite of the pieces of bark that he painted and is very proud of! However, Woodsy thinks that Scoutbadger’s artworks are very ugly…

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou goes to the theme part and rides his first rollercoaster!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and Leo make an erupting volcano for the science fair!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Cleo is shocked to learn snow does not last forever and tries to stop it from melting. But will her mission to save the snow be successful?.

programme.title: Chuggington 03
programme.desc: Eddie and Hodge have cleaned the sludge out of the chugwash. Now they’re going to refill the chugwash soap, then clean the underground tunnels using the Scrub-A-Chug - a fantastic piece of rolling stock with brushes that cleans the ceiling of the tunnel. Their work is interrupted when they get called away on an emergency. Wilson decides to be helpful by finishing their chores. Unfortunately, he accidentally replaces the chugwash soap with chugwash sludge - and when he tries to clean the tunnels with the Scrub-a-Chug, he ends up making an even bigger mess!

programme.title: Chuggington 03
programme.desc: Wilson is given the important job of taking some photos, to be used on a poster promoting Chuggington. Meanwhile, Dr. Ling has a special assignment for Hoot and Toot: pulling a robotic dinosaur around town to promote a new exhibition at the museum. Wilson isn’t having much luck taking exciting pictures - until he sees the dinosaur go by. Wowzer! He has to get a photo of that! He chases after it, but unfortunately has a collision. His camera flies off and lands out of reach - just as Hoot and Toot arrive with the dinosaur. Hoot has an idea. Extending the dinosaur’s neck, and using its jaws to grab, Hoot and Toot reach up and retrieve Wilson’s camera.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Charley just doesnt get it: everyone accuses him of things hes never done! Until he discovers a little boy on the sports course who looks a lot like him and is a real scoundrel. So hes the one doing the mischief, not Charley! But how do you tell the little rascal to behave?

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave have some big, tall fun in Hatty’s garden, but who is the tallest? Who is taller than Hatty’s tallest sunflower? Who is the tallest when wearing stilts? And what is the tallest thing they can see? When Tweet says she wants to be the tallest, her friends take her to the top of the tallest mountain - but she gets dizzy and decides she’s happy being the smallest after all.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Who reigns over the ocean? Doodleboo explains how to draw a Pirate.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Jayden, while hiking in the Canadian forest, discovers a tree about to fall and rushes to warn an opossum family. The mother opossum and her joeys are endangered as the tree crashes, and three babies end up trapped in an underground burrow. In the Garden, Katie is trying to wake up a sleeping Leo to water the flowers but he ends up waking up to a call from Jayden. Leo, Katie, and Hero rush to the rescue after learning about opossums. They devise a plan involving PlatypusOnes winch, Heros distraction, and Katies grabber to save the trapped joeys. However, the tree proves too heavy, and the winch detaches, leaving one joey stuck. The rangers and Hero unite to push the tree, with unexpected help from Ranger Rocky. They successfully free the last joey who plays possum to their horror but Ranger Joey explains the opossums playing possum behavior and the rangers wait a distance away to give it space and ensure the baby recovers. Eventually, the baby wakes up and gets on its mother, and the grateful family leaves. Back in the garden, Leo is about to water the flowers with Katie but finds her sleeping in his deck chair with Hero.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: One day Dolly leaves for and adventure with Harry Hedgehog, so she asks Bubbles to take care of her flowers while shes gone. Bubble forgets to water them, so they quickly wither. Now Bubble has to find a way to make the flowers bloom again.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The residents of the forest decide to celebrate the last day of the year with music. The ants form a choir, Dr Owl becomes the conductor, and all the little bugs create instruments for themselves. But Iris, the icebeetle loses her bells, so everyone starts to help her find them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The boys resent the girls for not telling them what Christmas surprise they have in mind for the night. But all things go well, when the surprise is revealed and their old friend, the Stargirl takes them on a magical ride on her starship in the clear night sky.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends go for a walk in the forest, but Bubbles cant stop hiccupping. His friends try to help him by giving all sorts of advice. To eat, drink, hold his breath... But none of them seem to help. Finally, Stanley scares Bubbles from behind the tree. The hiccup stops, but now Bubbles is offended by Stanley. They all make amends later, after Stanley saves Bubbles from slipping into the creek.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly - Fairy Cards Mepe
programme.desc: The forest friends decide to help the Millerbug fix his broken windmill, but the wind doesnt seem to be blowing. Zephyr goes on to save the day, by asking the Wind to help the group restart the mill. Finally, the Millerbug can prepare his delicious bread.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The playful rabbit wants to draw a big picture, so Flop finds him some chalk to create a stripy, spotty, zig-zag dinosaur on the pavement

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula find a potato in Amma’s vegetable patch with a comical ‘face’, so they take it under their wing, naming it “Nosey”. The two children look after Nosey and show him around the crèche but unfortunately Nosey goes down the slide too quickly and his ‘nose’ falls off. Amma shows them how to plant both bits of potato so that they can grow new potatoes.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing discovers a hole in his favourite yellow wellies but he doesnt want to throw them away in the stinky dustbin.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop hear the familiar jingle of Gillys ice cream van and race across the park to find her. After a long run Bing finally gets his ice cream but as he waves goodbye to Gilly he tips the ice cream out of the cone.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: In the absence of a real plaster, Bing makes one out of sticky tape, but it’s so sticky that it hurts when he tries to take it off.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Lemon and Raspberry make the final preparations for the contest. Strawberry offers the twins to be models at the contest instead of her. Sweet is delighted, but Sour is not excited. Shortly before the show is broadcast, Sour sabotages the TV equipment.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: In the morning, Rosie discovers that its Grandparents Day,which she had totally forgotten! But Grandpa and Grandma Fox are coming for dinner and she is intent on making a gift for them. She decides to create a show with the help of her sister, her brothers and Edmund. It will be The Three Little Badgers. Alas, nothing goes as Rosie hoped. The show is soon at risk, as Edmund, who was supposed to play the Big Bad Hurricane mustleave to help Casimir fix a collapsed dam.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare And Little Field Mouse are surprised to find an egg lying on the ground. Blue Bird agrees to look after it and when a rather odd and demanding bird hatches, she loves it like her own. When Little White Owl hears it calling one night, she tells them all that the ‘lucky chick’ is a baby owl and she will teach her all an owl needs to know.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare And Little Field Mouse go on an adventurous journey through the woods in search of a special Autumn leaf. They leave a trail of acorns to find their way home, but Little Grey Squirrel unwittingly collects the acorns and leaves them all lost in the woods. Luckily he is able to help when he climbs to the treetops and spies the meadow in the distance.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In the fall, the chimney sweep smoke beetle visits the forest friends to clean their chimneys. In Patricks chimney, he finds a shiny hair clip that turns out to be a gift Dolly sent to Katie via Pigeon Post. The friends solve the mystery together, and Katie finally receives the shiny hair clip.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia got bored. GrandMa lend them a long knitting needle that is supposed to indicate them the direction of great things to do. It seems it works, but is the needle really a magical one?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Mommy must go shopping but when she’s back, she wants the Triplets to play for her and her friend the new piece they learn The Flower’s Dance. Unfortunately, the day before, when Eliott was supposed to make them repeat, the Triplets preferred to play with their mini-cars. Which is way more fun! How will they manage to learn a piece in less than three hours? Hopefully, their imagination is always there to help.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplet’s armchair is quite damaged, Mommy decided to recover it with a new fabric and it will be to the siblings to choose the color! Poet wants blue, the color of the sky, Turbulent wants green, the country’s color, and Girl wants yellow, the color of the sun! Not easy to agree on a same color but careful! If they don’t decide quickly, Mommy will, and she has some strange color ideas like grey, the color of the rain!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Wilson has his bumpers full while babysitting an adorable monkey that goes bananas.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: At the garage, Joe, Hannah, and James try to point a giant laser beam at the moon to measure how far away it is. Norman worries they’ll lead Moon Men down to Pontypandy, putting everyone in danger… but it’s his panic that ends up causing a fire!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy wants to be the fastest delivery person ever! Her dad upgrades her scooter, and she speeds through her deliveries… until she hits a bump, loses her brakes, and needs to be rescued before she gets to the cliffs!

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Moths are spoiling an outdoor dinner for Kate and her parents. In Mimiloo, all of Kate’s friends are hiding from a dragon that’s after Gobble’s moon flowers! But when the dragon turns out to be more friendly than fearsome, Kate leads her friends on a quest to help the dragon find its way home.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate wants to fix her pop-up book without Mom’s help. In Mimiloo, everyone’s preparing to watch the butterfly flowers fly away after sunset. To get a good view, Tack tries to build a lighthouse all by himself—but loses his light bulb in the process! Kate must convince him that he needs his friends’ help to get his lighthouse working.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: After Caillou accidentally upsets Rosie by not listening when she asks him to stop pushing her on the swings, he pretends to be the Red Racer who has trouble getting a Giant (Rosie) to listen to him. Caillou learns that you should always listen to your friends, especially when they’re uncomfortable.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: When Mommy’s new plant is mysteriously knocked over, Caillou wants to find the culprit, but offends his family when he accuses them. In a detective fantasy, he learns that it can be hurtful to blame someone for something when you don’t have proof.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Snow comes early to the Island of Sodor – and it is heavier than usual! Donald and Douglas are coupled back-to-back with a van between their tenders and snowploughs on their fronts. Donald and Douglas keep squabbling about which line they should clear first, culminating in a big argument. Donald pulls away hard, snapping a damaged coupling and moving away with Douglas’s tender! So Douglas is left behind in the snow – without coal or water! The time apart helps cool the brothers’ tempers. They are delighted to be reunited in the end – and share water and coal from their tenders. Brothers!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kyle finds some mysterious tracks and cube-shaped poop outside a burrow. Curious, he approaches the burrow... but he falls in by accident and the entrance collapses behind him. Hes trapped! And hes not alone...theres a baby wombat trapped with him!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kyle is kept awake all night by a mysterious screech that seems to echo throughout the Tasmanian forest. The rangers are on it! After Katie deciphers an audio recording that Kyle sent, theyre able to identify the owner of the screech - a Tasmanian Devil.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat needs to make a special delivery to the school today - the Blue Flash superhero.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat must deliver eggs, milk, flour and butter to Greendale for the annual Pancake Race. But when Michael mixes all the ingredients together, Pat finds that he instead has to deal with a mixing bowl full to the brim with pancake mix... Meanwhile in Greendale, Saras attempts at pancake-tossing arent going well and she soon loses her pancake under the wheels of PC Selbys car. Even worse, Ted Glens amazing Pancake Machine has run out of mix so Sara wont be able to run the race unless Pat can get to Greendale on time...

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to play his car park game, but Charlie is visiting and keeps messing it up.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop play shadow tag until it starts raining and Bings shadow is outside getting wet.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its Bings turn to choose a game at Ammas crèche so he picks Musical Statues but gets upset when he loses because he chose the game.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When Bings mini racing car and the cereal box collide, they make a big mess. Voo Voo the vacuum cleaner does his job well - maybe even too well!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando discover a new climbing frame at the playground. It’s got climbing bits, tippy bits and even a wobbly bridge. But when Bing gets to the top of the slide it’s too scary for him to go down. Bing watches Pando to see how he does it, then he helps Hoppity Voosh to go down. When Hoppity likes it Bing has a go too.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: The Annual Big City Sand Sculpture Contest is taking place at the beach, and Oswald is judging the final entries. Each competitor has his or her own method of creating sand sculptures and there are some interesting results – Henry uses very exact methods while Daisy has a more unstructured approach. Oswald thinks that all of the sculptures are good in their own way and finds it very hard to decide who’s is the best. However, he ends up not having to choose when Pongo jumps into the sea making such a splash it causes all of the sculptures to merge into one beautiful and very unique giant sculpture – the clear winner!!

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald and Weenie find out that their favourite TV personality Sammy Starfish is playing for one night only at the Big City Auditorium. They rush out to buy tickets, saving a place in the queue for their friends. Oswald lets everyone else go first only to find they have sold out of tickets when it is his and Weenie’s turn. Distraught, Oswald turns to go home when he hears a stagehand struggling with a piano. Oswald kindly lends a hand and finds himself on stage with none other than Sammy Starfish! In fact, he ends up accompanying him on the piano!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and his gang are installing new barriers and laying a new paved driveway at FIxham Town Hall; at the end of the day a statue of Mayor Madison will be unveiled in the new driveway. Scoop is fitted with his pneumatic breaker and gets overexcited while using it, resulting in him breaking an underground water pipe and causing it to leak. While Bob and Wendy have some difficulty installing the barrier, Scoop covers up the leak and gets Muck to stand over the hole thus blocking the water from escaping. When Muck moves from this position Scoop speeds back to hide his mistake and causes Lofty to drop the paving slabs. The slabs are shattered! Scoop remarks on them looking like jigsaw pieces – giving Bob the idea of using the broken slabs to make crazy paving.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Tonight the Fixham Medieval Festival will open, but Maria Madison is appalled to discover that the castle has no portcullis. She summons Bob to put one in. Meanwhile Mr Bentley puts his foot through a rotten section of drawbridge as he eagerly heads into the castle to rehearse his lines. Leo becomes distracted role-playing as Prince Fix-a-Lot and traps himself behind the portcullis and inside the castle where he can hear a ghost wailing! Bob and the team hatch a plan to break into the castle to rescue Leo. First they fit a new drawbridge in place of the rotten one so that Muck can drive across and raise the portcullis with his bucket. Bob bravely ventures into the castle, saving Max and exposing the real ghost.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: A fun, spooky tale from little White Owl leaves the friends a little on edge, so when they hear strange noises in the pumpkin patch, they wonder what kind of creepy creature might be lurking there with them. Will Big Nutbrown Hare be able to convince them not to let their imaginations run away with them?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The friends are all playing together in the Autumn meadow. Little Redwood Fox inadvertently spoils all the games of the day, but the others put their heads together and come up with a game that suits her perfectly.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It’s a fine Autumn day and it seems that all of the meadow creatures are out enjoying the sun. Little Nutbrown Hare is surprised that Big Nutbrown Hare knows every single creature in the meadow. He sets out to trick him into believing there is a brand new animal… called a ‘Grrr-umph’, which he cleverly creates out of shadows! Will Big Nutbrown Hare be tricked?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Timmy and his friends are making a snowman. Can you help them?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: A mysterious giant circle appears in the middle of a corn field. Although Pig Will and Pig Won’t are convinced it’s the landing site of an alien flying saucer, Huckle puts the clues together and ultimately goes up in a hot air balloon to reveal the flattened area is actually Vincent Van Goat’s latest artistic endeavor./When flying potatoes are dropping from the sky in Busytown, Huckle and gang are determined to find out why.

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Messy is in the living room watching cartoons on the TV. As he watches he starts to wonder how do his cartoon characters get inside his telly anyway? He vortexes himself to Okido to find out. Messy arrives with a hop, skip and a jump into Zoe and Felix’s house, they’re dancing around to their favourite band who are performing on telly. Messy starts to join in. But all of a sudden, the television screen distorts. Felix tries to change the channel but discovers the TV shows don’t have Okido people in them instead they’re hosted by aliens!

programme.title: Messy Goes To Okido
programme.desc: Its night time in the real world, but Messy is not asleep. He’s at his window mesmerised by the night’s sky and all the distant lights he see can twinkling from far, far away. A curious Messy vortexes himself to Okido! Messy arrives just in time to catch Felix and Zoe heading to Zim Zam and Zooms. Apparently they’ve made a discovery and have breaking news for the whole of Okido! At the Cloudship, Mayor Oki is preparing to be filmed by a camera man whilst Zim, Zam and Zoom introduce their news.

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: Apple Dumplin comes to visit her cousin Strawberry. Soon she causes trouble: she installs a light/music display in Strawberrys bedroom, but cannot turn it off; later she causes a power failure. After Apple leaves, it is revealed that she fixed the power.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry has a nightmare in which he is chased by a monster, so he goes to Dino World in an attempt to hide from it.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry is upset to learn that he must return his library book so decides to hide the book in Dino-World.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: In New Zealand, Kyle practices his boomerang skills on the beach, but it gets carried away into the forest. While searching for it, he stumbles upon two Yellow-Eyed Penguins in the middle of the forest with one shooing the other away. Puzzled by their presence, Kyle contacts the Junior Rangers, who, in the Garden, are dealing with Heros impatience for his repaired jetpack. During the call, they learn that the penguin might be looking for its nest but suddenly, it scurries off towards the beach. The team travels to New Zealand in PlatypusOne to assist Kyle and the penguin but it’s nowhere to be found now. They try to figure out where the nest could be while the poor lost penguin checks nests of other penguin and gets shooed off everytime. As an attempt to look for it better, they use their jetpacks, and Kyle climbs a tree to search from higher ground but discovers no leads. With help from Ranger Rocky and information from Ranger Joey, they decide to look inland and use PlatypusOne to search from a birds’ eye view and eventually, they successfully locate the penguin’s fledgling and nest which results in a heartwarming reunion. Back at the Treehouse, Leo hangs a picture of the new penguin friend, celebrating another successful wildlife rescue. Meanwhile, Hero, now equipped with a fixed jetpack, flies excitedly in the garden but gets himself stuck in a tree.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Percy becomes paranoid about the snow, his nerves get the better of him, causing confusion on the rails.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: While Thomas is working on the Indian railway, Rajiv learns that he can be really useful with or without his crown

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: When Stella and David find a seagull that can’t fly, Grisu becomes the bird’s flight instructor. The little dragon tries all kinds of ways to coax the bird to fly, but nothing works. Grisu decides the bird needs to understand the feeling of flight, so he builds a large hang glider and takes the bird for a ride in the sky. Fume is so delighted to see his son in the air that he flies up to him, scaring Grisu and the bird…which causes Grisu to burn the hang glider. Thanks to all Grisu has show the seagull, the bird spreads its wings and flies. But will Grisu…?

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Stranavoce is to do a recital in the main square, accompanied on the piano by Stella. David, her daughter and Grisu drive to Stranavoces to get his piano and move it to the venue. But David suddenly has to go on an emergency and takes the singer – who wants to rehearse at the main square – with him. So Stella and Grisu decide to move the piano (its on wheels) all by themselves. They soon hit a slope and cant push the piano up it. Fume comes in and without being asked, pushes the piano up the hill with the kids on it. But then Fume trips and the piano rolls down the other side, ending up in a haystack by the farm.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: A Summer storm sweeps across the valley and a nervous Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends scamper into a cave with Big Nutbrown Hare. They are all safe and dry in the cave, but the thunder outside is still scary. Big Nutbrown Hare explains that noises can’t hurt you… but will he help them overcome their fears enough to enjoy the storm and the wonders of nature that it brings?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: A lazy Summer’s day brings a wonderful discovery for Little Nutbrown Hare… a tree full of bright, beautiful, tasty plums! Little Nutbrown Hare isn’t the only one enjoying the juicy summer fruit, it seems like every animal in the meadow has come for a taste. As the Summer goes on the plums disappear and Little Nutbrown Hare begins to wonder what all the animals will do without them.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: The trainees have to assess each other as they do braking tests in the park. Wilson doesn’t do so well – and the trainees consider reporting that he did better than he actually did. In the end, Wilson decides they should be honest to Vee, even if it means forfeiting his badge – but Vee tells them the badge wasn’t for braking, but for good judgment, which they’ve shown by telling the truth!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Berry sees a shooting star in the sky and makes a wish to become a princess, Princess Berry. To spare her from being disappointed, Rosie, Scoutbadger and Woodsy pretend that she has indeed really become a princess. But Princess Berry turns out to be a very demanding princess…

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Jenny Dobbs, the zoo keeper, asks Bob to finish building the new bear enclosure at Spring City zoo. He plans a three-tiered natural habitat that resembles a rocky mountain, with a pool and cave for shelter. Scoop thinks the mountain needs to be a tall as possible in order to keep the bear happy, and he convinces Muck and Lofty to help him. Unfortunately they build it too high. The rocks and soil in-fill cant take the weight and the whole mountain collapses. Scoop apologises, but Bob quite likes the idea of a bigger structure and alters the design so they can re-build the mountain with four levels. They finish just in time as a crate carrying the bear arrives.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob and the team are completing work on a brand new fitness trail in the sports stadium park. They must finish before the afternoon’s Spring City Fun Run - a steeplechase across the fitness trail obstacle course, organised by Scoop’s idol Skye Sampson, a fitness guru and world champion record-breaking athlete. When Scoop is told that only humans will be competing, he sets up his own competition: the Muscle Machine Games! With events including “Weightlifting” (with a pallet of wooden beams) and “Discuss Throw” (with an old tyre) Lofty and Muck both break new records...

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Hilda arrives at Sallys dance party, shes suddenly struck with a severe case of the sneezes. Thinking shes come down with a cold, her friends take her to Doctor Lion who informs her she has an allergy to something. It turns out shes allergic to her best friend Sally - or rather, the new rose-scented perfume Sallys wearing./Huckle, Lowly and Sally find they have their mystery-solving hands full when things start disappearing, in the blink of an eye!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: An unusual guest shows up in Leo’s swimming pool—a dugong! Come along with the Junior Rangers as they seek a safe home for the dugong. But can they accomplish that while warding off a ship of dugong hunters?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A baby bottlenose dolphin is the last animal Leo expects to see in his garden pond. But when the unexpectable happens, the Junior Rangers start on an expedition to find the dolphin’s mother.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Gaspard are waiting for their Grandpa to return to them with some eggs when they get very interested in the tractor parked next to Grandpas sidecar.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Mama Owls chicks are born, and soon they are strong enough for Berry and Dolly to visit them. Doctor Owl asks for their help while he works. The owl babies are very lively, and Berry and Dolly play with them enthusiastically and patiently. At lunchtime, Mama Owl is running out of patience, but eventually, they manage to feed the chicks. After finishing lunch and resting a little, the little ones regain their energy. They happily jump around Mama Owl, who feels it is time that the chicks learn to fly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, plays beautifully on his violin for the forest inhabitants, but one day, no one listens to his new piece. First, he looks for Berry, Balthazar, and Stanley, but they are busy. He goes to Dolly, but she doesn’t have time either. Very discouraged, he decides to leave the forest. However, he meets the Magpie, who welcomes him and cheers him up. Meanwhile, the others begin to search for Alfonso. When they find him, they apologize and invite him to play his new piece at the playground opening.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: One autumn day, Reggie Squirrel is visited by his old friend, Otto Badger, who brings a frisbee as a gift. They happily play with it, and when they head home, the frisbee falls at the base of a tree. Later, Berry and his friends find it and play with it, but Balthazar throws it so far that the frisbee vanishes. Reggie Squirrel asks them about it later, but Balthazar denies having seen it. Dolly and Flutter find the frisbee and bring it back to Reggie. Berry, feeling ashamed, admits that they accidentally threw the frisbee and couldnt find it. In the end, they all play happily with it until dark, carefully making sure not to throw it too far.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Leapy, the grasshopper girl, gets paint on her hair while painting her house in the spring. She can’t wash it off, so Zephyr, the dragonfly, offers to cut her hair. Leapy is very sad when she sees herself in the mirror; she doesn’t like her new hairstyle. At Zephyrs suggestion, they show the others, but only Dolly notices the change and compliments her. Later, they hold a hairstyle day, where everyone creates special hairstyles for themselves. Leapy happily finishes painting her house and invites her friends to a spring feast.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Stanleys birthday is approaching, and he becomes very curious and can’t wait to find out what gift he will receive from Dolly. He peeks into the ladybird girls drawer. The next day, he tells Balthazar that he knows what his gift will be. On his birthday, the friends gather and wish Stanley a happy birthday. Flutter presents the cake, they sing, and then Stanley blows out the candles and cuts the cake. Stanley receives many nice gifts, including a bowling set from Dolly. Stanley admits that he peeked into the ladybird girls drawer because he was curious about his gift.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Shaun invites his friends to Sand Island during the summer heatwave. Christopher and Chloe, the two canaries, ferry the friends over. Bubble, Balthazar, Dolly, Stanley, Berry, Flutter, and Shaun build sand houses. Balthazar accidentally knocks down Bubble the flower beetles house. Suddenly, a summer shower begins and washes away all the sand houses. They stand sadly around their ruined creations and decide to build a large drip sandcastle together. Side by side, they build drip towers, construct castle walls, and decorate the tops with sand balls. The day passes joyfully, and by the evening, when the canaries come to pick them up, magnificent drip towers stand tall on the island.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: At the end of summer, the Star Girl visits her friends. She rarely comes because her star-shaped house is in the sky. They spend a day together, and when night falls, the Star Girl bids everyone farewell. She can’t speak, but she plays the harp beautifully. The music will lift her house into the sky. However, this time one of the harp strings comes loose, and the house doesn’t rise. The Wind blows the string out of her hand, and she can’t catch it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s bath time and Bing just can’t help adding a few more quirts of bubble goo…and a few more….and a few more, until he gets more bubbles than he can handle.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing goes to play with Sula who is engrossed in a game of ‘sparkle magic’ when he arrives. Bing wants to play too but Sula finds all sorts of reasons why Bing can’t play with her special sparkly things. Amma suggests that Bing makes his own sparkle magic stone but disaster strikes when Bing accidentally spills Sula’s precious sparkle dust.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to dig the biggest hole and gets upset when Pando accidentally fills it in.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Amma have come to Bings house for lunch but there are no carrots so Flop pops to the shop to get some. Bing stays behind but its not long before he starts to miss Flop. Missing Flop... its a Bing thing!

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: As Rupert would prefer to read than go out for a walk with Tilda, he pretends to have a cold. At once, Tilda declares herself his nurse and makes tea for him, gives him nose massages and makes him gargle, take cold foot baths and do a special keep fit programme.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Spring has arrived and Tilda fervently wants to paint a white sheep on a green meadow. She grabs her easel and sets off. Her friends may have lots of other suggestions for things she could paint, but she has her heart set on a sheep. Her friend Patrick the sheep turns out to be a difficult model: he just cant keep still.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: When Molly visits Tilda, her friend is looking for a birthday present for Rupert. In the end, Tilda decides on a blue scarf. Molly suggests sending Rupert the present as a parcel to make the surprise all the bigger. A great idea, thinks Tilda.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare, Little Field Mouse and Big Nutbrown Hare go up to high meadow with Big Nutbrown Hare they get caught in the mist. It’s a little scary so they hold hands and pass the time by playing guessing games. As the mist starts to lift, they see a beautiful circle rainbow around the sun.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is excited because Big Nutbrown Hare has agreed to meet him later to play games. When his father arrives to tell him a storm is coming and he needs to gather food instead, Little Nutbrown Hare is hiding so Big Nutbrown Hare leaves. He searches the meadow for his father, more and more disappointed, but when he learns why Big Nutbrown Hare couldn’t play this time, he understands.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse discover creatures that can blend in with their surroundings and are inspired to learn just where they can blend in. Little Nutbrown hare becomes disappointed when his white fluffy tail and his dark brown ear tips give him away each time. That’s until he discovers the reeds by the river are exactly the right height and colours to camouflage him perfectly.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and Gaspard start playing a game of Tag while Mummy and Daddy are asleep, but what starts out as a game between two becomes a game for the whole family!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo catches a raccoon digging around in his trash. The Junior Rangers take the raccoon back to the forest where it can find its own food. However, some unfriendly raccoons make things difficult for Leo and company...

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: To earn his Training Badge, Wilson must teach Hoot and Toot how to use the paint car. Unfortunately, he’s so busy demonstrating how good he is at painting, he doesn’t teach them anything. He realises his mistake when time is nearly up – he should have been showing them instead of showing off! Wilson sadly goes through a list of all the things he should have taught them. Hoot and Toot listen closely and surprise Wilson by passing their test. Wilson earns his badge after all!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Brewster learns about camouflage when he repaints the lizard’s house.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When Fanni accidentally knocks over Tchoupi and Nina’s cushion cabin, it prompts them to build a real cabin, in the forest, opening up a whole new adventure! However, when they get to the forest, Tchoupi grows increasingly scared after spotting a spider! In the end, however, he realizes that the animals of the forest are actually way more nervous than he is!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi misses out on going to the market with Fred, Nina decides to cheer him up by suggesting they sell their wares at the market, like a couple of adults -right there, in the hamlet where they live! The friends find some great produce, which they then promptly sell to their parents. The latter are delighted with their wares; only problem is, Dad would have loved to be able to bake a yummy pie but has no eggs with which to make it…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: While out on a picnic with T’choupi and his family, plus Nina, Dad chances upon a four-leaf clover! He gifts it to Fanni as a lucky charm. As a result, convinced that he’s having a bad day, T’choupi is now determined to find a four-leaf clover of his own, to turn the tide and enjoy nothing but good fortune for the rest of the day!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: This evening, Anna is taking them for a pony ride! Particularly enthusiastic, Charley spends the day telling his friends what a great knight he is! But when its time to get in the saddle, he makes a sudden move, frightening his horse, who then starts neighing loudly... Scared, Charley invents excuses not to go for the ride on his pony. Will he be able to overcome his fear?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia sleeps badly, disturbed by a nightmare that comes back every night. In order to help her find back her sleep and her dynamism, Sam invents a trap to capture bad dreams. Will it work?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Arriving from a faraway island, Julia the little mouse moves into a new home with her mother. There she meets Sam, another young mouse whos long lived with his parents and a whole gang of brothers and sisters. They quickly become inseparable and enjoy a host of fun adventures together.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia have planned to play in their lair but Tonio wants to find out where it is! Noit so easy to fool him. But what if this game turns out to be even more fun than the one originally planned?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Gordon and Rebecca do the same work, but differently. When Rebecca tries to be more like Gordon, it does not go well

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When Kenji hears that he must travel home to Japan alone, he gets scared and tries to hide. So, Thomas sets out to find him.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou gets ready for his first day back at school and Mommy packs him a lunchbox surprise!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou learns how to make fresh pasta and pizza at home!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Someone in Busytown Park got rid of Sally and Hildas newly drawn hopscotch board. Huckle and Lowly set about helping the girls find out whos responsible. As it turns out the culprit isnt a who, but a what - the parks new sprinkler system washed the chalk drawing clean off the sidewalk./ Mr. Gronkle’s great great grandfather has hidden a priceless treasure somewhere and it’s up to Huckle and the gang to find it.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: This morning Monkey just doesnt want to wake up, but one of his friends just wont let him go back to sleep. Well, if you cant beat them join them, and Monkey is very happy to join his friend the Rooster and play Monkey’s favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: It is a perfect day in the jungle, perfect for practicing to swing. Look at how Monkey swings from one vine to the other, but wait, what is that? That is not a vine….it is Snake. Well, you know what comes next; Monkey invites his friend to play in his favorite game… “Monkey See Monkey Do”!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Getting competitive over new game Alien Bug Hunt, Norman, James, Sarah and Mandy take a boat out to sea to find the last Alien Bug, but run into trouble when James falls overboard!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Station Officer Steele decides to direct his own musical and casts Norman as the lead. Norman’s love for the spotlight gets out of control lighting up the stage in the wrong way!

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: When Mr. Turtle and Mr. Fox build a mini-putt course for Franklin and Fox, Franklin becomes so intent on performing well and winning that he ends up having a terrible time. Its only when he sees the two dads goofing around on the course and having a ball no matter what the score, that he realizes the game is meant to be fun above all. / Franklin gives Fox an old broken radio from his giveaway pile. But when Fox fixes it up and plays cool music for their delighted friends, Franklin suddenly decides he wants the radio back for himself. But when taking it back only ends up making him feel crummy, Franklin realizes that when you give something away, you have to let go.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Woodsy wants to decorate his room with a huge branch that he found lying in the river and which he believes to be very beautiful. But his room is also Scoutbadger’s room and the latter doesnt agree at all. Scoutbadger thinks that this piece of wood isnt pretty at all. Quite the opposite of the pieces of bark that he painted and is very proud of! However, Woodsy thinks that Scoutbadger’s artworks are very ugly…

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Doodleboo is invited to the inauguration of a new play park, but Sketcky cannot accompany him. Fortunately, Doodleboo found him the best babysitter!

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Its a deal-Doodleboo, Sketcky and Bubble go on vacation. But seeing Sketcky rack up the baggage, Doodleboo digs his head to find a way to transport everything without getting tired. What will his good idea be this time?

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Sketcky is surprised: there are plenty of insects in Doodleboos garden, but almost no flies! Doodleboo knows what flies dislike and makes them fly away, and he will make Sketcky guess!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave have some big, tall fun in Hatty’s garden, but who is the tallest? Who is taller than Hatty’s tallest sunflower? Who is the tallest when wearing stilts? And what is the tallest thing they can see? When Tweet says she wants to be the tallest, her friends take her to the top of the tallest mountain - but she gets dizzy and decides she’s happy being the smallest after all.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave take their Rollypods to the Rollypod Garage for a bubble makeover! They fix Dave’s broken car-hooter, pump up their tyres so their Rollypods will go faster and polish up their paintwork until it sparkles. Then it’s time to show off their shiny new vehicles in a friendly Rollypod race!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare befriends a little yellow fluffy creature by the river, and it follows him everywhere, quacking and copying his every move. It’s too little to speak and doesn’t look like any creature Little Nutbrown Hare or his friends have seen before. How will he return it to its parents if he doesn’t know what kind of creature it is?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare sees Blue Bird building a nest, he thinks it looks like fun, so he and Little Field Mouse build one themselves. But its a bit too scratchy and tickly for them to get comfortable in. They give it to their friends to try out, but they also find it not quite right. Will anybody find their nest cozy and useful?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Big Nutbrown Hare teaches Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends to play hide-and-seek, but the boisterous little hare finds it hard to stay still and quiet, especially when the Spring meadow is full of birds, butterflies and lizards to chase. When he does manage to stay still and quiet he finds the creatures of the meadow come to him… even very shy ones.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s a hot day and Bing and Flop buy an ice lolly from Gilly the ice cream lady. Before they can eat them a frog hops into Bing’s paddling pool and they go to the rescue. By the time they return to the ice lollies all that’s left are the sticks and a plate of lolly goo.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets very enthusiastic when he and Sula paint a mural and his painting starts to drop all over Sulas. Sula is upset until she realises that the painting isnt spoiled, its just different.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing gets stuck when he takes a game of hide-and-seek too far.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop are building a sandcastle when Pando joins them in the sandpit with his wind-up digger toy to help. Bing finds a lovely ‘poiky thing’ in the sand and thinks it will make the perfect decoration for the top of his castle not realizing it belongs to Pando’s digger.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula collect acorns in the park with Flop, but Bings pile keeps shrinking.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The five girls are getting ready for a spring welcoming party, where they will perform a spring dance. They share their plan with the mushrooms, who are thrilled and offer their hats. Rosita, the rose beetle promises to return them, but Berry puts the hats back incorrectly. Rosita puts them back in the correct order and, as an apology, the girls also present their dance to the mushrooms

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: In April, the Pigeon post brings the ants a bouncy castle. Its Dr Owls task to invite everyone for the jumping session, but Berry is nowhere to be found. Hail interrupts the jumping fun, but the friends seek shelter in the ant castle. The toy gets damaged, but with the help of a cloud, Berry can also join the jumping. Then the ants rebuild the castle, and everyone happily continues jumping.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Balthazar and Stanley are building a raft that gets carried away by the stream. They end up far from home, but then decide to head back during a storm. Christopher, the canary helps them, but they fall off during a gust of wind. They find refuge in a hollow to rest where they are finally discovered and helped to go home by the Spider. The next day, they play along the stream again, but they no longer worry if the raft run away.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, tries to bake an apple pie, but unfortunately, it doesnt turn out well. With the help of a fairy, she manages to fix it and then finds a lost marker and repairs the window as well. The Lily Fairy discovers that Flutter solved everything on her own and then moves on to help others.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Forgetful Mayor Fox has misplaced the giant key to the city that hes supposed to be presenting to a visiting astronaut. Huckle and his pals try to figure out where he set it down. They learn that Mayor Fox did one thing while touring a candy factory that required both his hands - stirring a huge pot of candy goo. Not far away they find a big chocolate-covered key./When Busytown residents are baffled by mysterious door knocking, Huckle and gang discover who it is.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: We see Parrot packing a picnic basket, Mole appears and suggests taking a magnifying glass so they can explore nature and all of its small wonders. When they arrive they spread out the food. Monkey turns to thank Parrot for the sandwich, when he looks back he discovers the food is gone leaving only a trail of crumbs. Monkey follows the crumbs until he gets to Mouse.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Tom Thomas tries to help the Pioneers earn their bird watching badges using a fancy new APP, his phone obsession causes him to tumble over a cliff! Without Tom to fly the helicopter, it’s up to a mysterious new character to save the day…

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Sarah is excited to shadow Sergeant Rose Ravani until she gets stuck filing maps. But when Gareth and Nipper go missing in the woods, Rose leads their rescue mission

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: One of Kate’s cookies goes missing when she’s not looking! In Mimiloo, colourful things are mysteriously disappearing. Detectives Kate and Mim-Mim must follow the clues to discover the identity of the colour-loving culprit.

programme.title: Kate And Mim Mim
programme.desc: Kate’s nightlight isn’t working, and she’s afraid to sleep in the dark. In Mimiloo, Kate and her friends go exploring in the furthest depths of the Singing Seas. But Mim-Mim is afraid of the dark waters and the scary creatures that must live underwater, so it’s up to Kate and her friends to make him feel safe.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: When T’choupi chances upon an old Polaroid camera while rummaging through a chest, Dad sees it as a perfect opportunity to do an animal photo safari in the forest! T’choupi, Nina and Luce love the idea; Luce, especially, is excited at the (unlikely) prospect of spotting a baby tiger! Unfortunately, the animals are difficult to find, keeping themselves to themselves, but the kids manage in the end to take a bunch of cute wildlife photos. All of a sudden, a mysterious creature pokes its snout out between two rocks... Could it be a baby tiger…?!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Fred has found some bowling pins he had as a child. He asks T’choupi and Nina if they want to play but they turn him down, finding the game too old. But when Dad arrives on the scene, his face lights up as soon as he sets eyes on the pins: he had this same game when he was little, and used to love playing it! Seeing their nostalgic dads playing, T’choupi and Nina realize that they too would like to join in. But their fathers are having so much fun that they don’t dare disturb them… Maybe they could make their own bowling pin game, instead…?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia is angry with Sam who stepped on her tail. Sam hurt her and she lost her balance. Julia doesnt want to talk to him anymore! As best he can, Sam tries to make up with his friend.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia pretended to Sam she can do real magic. To prove him so, Julia has to find a way to do that. She will have to find different tricks to let her friend believe she really is a magician.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda is excited about the cake contest, but when she burns her hands, she can’t bake anymore. Her friends at the Guesthouse Appleseed decide to help her by creating a special cake together.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: It is raining a lot outside and the Triplets are bored. Only people who have no imagination get bored, says Mom. The Triplets have many faults but a lack of imagination is not one of them! They start pretending they are drifting on a raft.
